description:
Oddly, the game runs beautifully with mods, etc via Dalamud. 

Only issue I've found is an about 33% drop in FPS vs playing via Steam instead. Still totally playable at 60fps with no issues. If you want more then, maybe a mixed bag?

Hard to tell the cause. Could be a newer Ubuntu 24.04 or whatever, but launching the game via Steam I get at or better FPS than what I get on Windows. When launching via XIV launcher there is a noticeable dropoff, unfortunately.
summary: Runs smoothly and well, with a dip in FPS vs Steam

description: I was near tears trying to get XIV working through steam, but then I googled and found this launcher! Unlike the experience of trying to create a trial account first through steam and then via Enixes' website, the installation, download, and experience of using XIV Launcher has been flawless! It downloaded Dawntrail with an update immediately after the launch too. It's been very nice and stable, and the only crashes I've ever experienced have been when the FF XIV servers have been too overloaded. I've been playing on Nobara 39, and after an update, 40.
Works great but there still isn't an auto-start tab which makes it impossible to configure certain things like XIVAlexander.
Works 100% of the time. The flatpak is the way to go if you don't want to mess around too much or are new to Linux.

Launcher not updated for DT yet, you can log in but it will show the endwalker login and you cant accept the new quests because the game thinks your license is not registered. has probably somethign to do with a new eula that you get prompted to accept on the regular square enix launcher -> XIVlauncher does not give you this new eula to accept. works well otherwise
Works great! Just had to follow their guide
Works like a charm on Fedora 40
No messing around, just works!
summary: Easiest way to play FFXIV on Linux

description: Best way to get XIV working on your Steam Deck, espcially with current headaches with Steam accounts
Easiest way to install FFXIV if you have bought the game on the Square Enix store.
summary: Native implementation of a good custom launcher for FFXIV

description: made a typo and my username is permanently stuck
Need some polish, but finally no more messing around with proton
I click on the text box to type my username and password but I can't...
Game works perfectly

ive been running ff14 through my lutris app and its easy there but i fund that the look and feel for this launchner is amazing and i can log into another account and im able to use a different login since my wife also plays once in a while. have yet to have any issues.
summary: perfect app if you dont want to mess with lutris

description: didn't have any issues pressing the install button and logging in once installed. get solid 60 on max settings and crashes less then what my friends have experienced on windows.
can't input username or password.
Can't type username and password in on deskop mode.
loving it so far!

worked great at first, but stopped letting me enter my password.
began after last update....
launcher runs good, please add ACT connection like standard pc
only issue i have is that the dalamud extesion finder sometimes does now show on the menu screen or in the options
Cannot believe the dedication and hard work for free!
not able to enter password or username
i cant enter passwort or username right know i hope it vets fixed
No way to enter credentials. Does not do the literal only thing it is for.
As long as you follow the instructions there are no issues with this patcher. It is amazing to be able to play on the Deck without having to get the steam version.
1-stars, the documentation clearly says to use gaming mode to enter credentials. Won't work in desktop due to an API limitation.
Dont listen to some of these reviews claiming it does not work, if you follow a guide online it will work for you
Fresh deck, fresh install, fast load and patch... second and all openings after takes 5 mins unresponsive then is permanently trying to log in. tried reinstalling to no avail.
Please follow the online guide as this will help with the log in "issues". literally just ppl not following instructions properly.

Log in, enter OTP, then game just... doesn't appear.
"SteamApi_Init returned false. Steam isn't running" of course not, Steam isn't in use. No other errors anywhere in logs.
I have all Steam options disabled, I do not use Steam, and am NOT on a Steam Deck. All FAQs appear to be for the Steam Deck so I cannot even work out where to start to fix it.
Make sure to follow install instructions to the letter and it will work
No problem so far, sometime it has trouble launching but it's pretty rare. Was affraid of updates but it went smooth. Includes Dalamud if needed and has an auto-login feature to skip the launcher.

The volunteer developers that put together this enhanced launcher Flatpak that can run Final Fantasy XIV have done an amazing job with this software. Much like many Flatpak software, using Flatseal to help manage permissions and understanding how Flatpak works can help make using this software easier.
garbage, doesn't work 90% of fthe time. stick to default launcher.
Had a small issue installing but searching the error message found me the solution. Works great!
This launcher works really well on Steam Deck. Playing FFXIV on the couch or in bed is fun.
works well on deck, no issues

The application takes minutes just to open, then even longer to log in, and often simply hangs up, I haven't been able to open FFXIV at all using this program, despite entirely removing it and doing a fresh reinstall. Something is wrong.

I have followed all the steps but whenever i open the app it says install free trial of FFXIV to internal drive to continue. I have done this and the app will not move from this page/message.

I have installed and uninstalled both app and ffxiv multiple times to no avail. it is broken
followed all instructions, and it won't recognize that XIV is installed on the deck itself, rebooted, reinstalled, no luck
wont show up as a game to add to Steam, just plain doesn't work. just skip this or try installing the windows version on your deck. dont waste time with this
Does not respond to the backspace key. Must uninstall then reinstall the whole launcher to clear the password field to try again. Better input all credentials the first time if you want it to work.

got the trial version to launch by going to GE 8-3 and can play the game but the launcher no longer logs me in and when on the main page the news doesn't load so I guess there is some kind of disconnect somewheres. I did reintall everything and it worked once but went back to not even loading anything right after my second time booting the game. I will say I'm going to miss the dalumund plugins but oh well.
When installing the 6.4 ffxiv update it now does not recognize the free trial is installed

Thanks a lot! It makes FFXIV installation much easier. No as straightforward as clic and install but what is with Square Enix anyway? That solve 95% of the problems! 
Don´t forget the run it from steam by adding it as a non-steam app and change the launch option to:

XL_SECRET_PROVIDER=FILE %command% run --parent-expose-pids --parent-share-pids --parent-pid=1 --branch=stable --arch=x86_64 --command=xivlauncher dev.goats.xivlauncher
see title... sadface.
As title, runs for a minute or two then quits out altogether suddenly
summary: 1.0.3 was great, 1.0.4 crashes after a minute

description: 1.0.4 working great. For people having issues with crashes please disable plugins, especially unofficial unsupported plugins, until they're all adequately updated to accomodate the newest release. It's very nice to have such a convenient launcher on-the-go with the Deck. I appreciate all the support the team continues to provide for linux-based systems.
is not letting me go back the login page
was perfect now can't log in at all
Frequent crashes since updating to 1.0.4. Usually on startup or during login process
Previsouly it worked flawlessly but since the release of 6.5, XIVLauncher wont patch the game.
I started launcher told me to update but no update on discover store.

XIVLauncher's Linux release is not only the easiest way to get FFXIV up and running on Linux, it's also selects some of the best WINE and DXVK versions to run the game with, leading to less crashes and better performance. It's hard to get a better result even if you setup your WINE prefixes manually.

The amount of effort that has gone into making the Linux launcher work, work consistently, and provide one of the best experiences possible is so impressive, and the people that have worked on this launcher deserve so much credit for the work they've put in to provide a FREE and open-source launcher. Five stars forever bb
the default launcher is absolute trash, even if you don't use mods/dalamud this is a huge step up, but speaking of dalamud.... so awesome, 10/10
Works perfectly ln Steam Deck with no modification
this used to work 30% percent of the time now it works 0% of the time save youself the headache and find something else
It works like a charm on Steam Deck.
Чтение исходников позволяет понять что софт должен делать, потому что в исходниках кроме инструкций для компьютера есть ещё семантическая нагрузка, передающая смысл и намерения человека.
summary: Люди пишут софт, потому что он помогает другим людям
